Sentencas: Yttrium-doped BaCeO3 is one of the most promising electrolyte candidates for solid oxide fuel cells because of its high ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: Nd and Y co-doped BaCeO3 strategy is adopted for the further optimization of Y-doped BaCe03 electrolyte properties.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction results indicate that the structure of BaCe0.8Y0.2-xNdxO3.delta (x = 0, 0.05, 0.1, 0.15) with orthorhombic perovskite phase becomes more symmetric with increasing Nd concentration.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: The scanning electron microscope observation demonstrates that the densification and grain size of the sintered pellets significantly enhance with the increase of Nd doping level.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: Whether in dry and humid hydrogen or air, the increase of Nd dopant firstly increases the conductivities of BaCe0.8Y0.2-xNdxO3.delta (x = 0, 0.05, 0.1, 0.15) and then decrease them after reaching the peak value at x = 0.05.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectra at 350 degrees C can distinguish clearly the contribution of grain and grain boundary to total conductivity and the highest conductivity of BaCe(0.8)Yosi(0).15Nd0.05O3.delta ascribes to the decrease in bulk and grain boundary resistances due to the synergistic effect of Nd and Y doping.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte

Sentencas: The anode-supported single cell with BaCe0.8Y0.15Nd0.05O3.delta electrolyte shows an encouraging peak power density of 660 mW cm(-2) at 700 degrees C, suggesting that BaCe0.8Y0.15NdO3.delta s is a potential electrolyte material for the highly-efficient proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Further optimization of barium cerate properties via co-doping strategy for potential application as proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte
